name: Mixr Cocktail App
description: I'm an amatuer bartender in my free time, and I found myself consistently frustrated when I go to fulfil a specific cocktail craving and realize I'm missing ingredients. I built Mixr mobile-first with my team to solve that. It tracks your pantry and recommends cocktails you can make based on what you've got on hand, among other cool features for the aspiring mixologist. This app won the Fall 2020 UW Coding Bootcamp award for Best UI/UX.

name: GeneriCo Employee Search
description: I built this as a way of experimenting with combining React with data from an external API. It generates a random set of 50 employees and then allows you to search through them by name as well as sort by a variety of parameters.

name: Photo Galleria
description: This photo database app is built with React on the front end and Ruby on Rails on the back. I built it as a way of increasing my skills with using the two in conjunction, and also to work on keeping up good functionality while interacting with state in React on multiple levels at the same time.

name: Wandir Journaling App
description: During the COVID-19 lockdown, I was really missing travel and doing a lot of nostalgic reminiscing about places I've been and things I've done. I built Wandir with a team of 3 other devs to scratch that itch and fill a gap in the market for people specifically looking to orient their journaling and photo sharing around geographic points. Wandir uses overlapping many to many relationships to let users track places they've been and associated journal entries and photos. It's also integrated with Google Maps for easy searching and location tracking for the user.

name: Find my Rep Dashboard
description: Before I entered tech, I worked in campaign politics, so it's very close to my heart. I orked with a team to build this simple dashboard for voters to quickly get information about who their officials are, how to contact them, and, if they've been in the news, learn a bit about their recent activity.

name: Google Books API Search & Save
description: This easy-to-use application uses ReactJS, MongoDB Atlas, Express, and Material UI to allow you to search the Google Books API and save books for future reference. I took on this project after I graduated from the UW Coding Bootcamp as a way to refine my skills with React and NoSQL databases, and teach myself Material UI as a CSS Framework.

name: Hourly Planner
description: This is a simple To Do List site where I mainly wanted to experiment with updating the DOM based on the time of day, as well as develop my abilities using local storage in a browser. Check back at different times of day and you'll see different hours highlighted, so you don't fall behind.

name: Weather Forecast Dashboard
description: This is a simple weather forecast app that I built as I was learning to work with APIs and update the DOM based on different variables. I've learned a lot since I built this, but I like it as an early example of my work as I found my footing as a developer.
